name: Shubbham Gupta
objective: PhD-researcher in SFI CRT Data Science with deep hands-on experience in predictive analytics, scalable ML pipelines, and Bayesian modeling. Proven ability to implement cloud-native solutions in healthcare and pharma, apply SOLID principles, and deploy robust AI systems using MLOps/LLMOps.

education.details: Specialized in predictive modeling and feature selection for metabolic disorders. Contributed to international collaboration, teaching, and a peer-reviewed publication.

education.degree: MSc in Data and Computational Science
education.details: Focused on survival analysis, predictive analytics, Bayesian methods, and programming with R, Mathematica, Fortran.

education.degree: B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering
education.details: Studied OS, web development, big data, programming in C++, Java, Python. Gained database and software development experience.

details: Developed a Bayesian GLM model for intra-individual metabolite variations.
Built R package with Shiny dashboard.
Collaborated with Helmholtz Zentrum Mucnchen.
Awarded Best Poster at the 42nd Conference on Applied Statistics in Ireland.
Authored peer-reviewed publication in Metabolites and contributed to open-source packages.

experience.role: Data Science and AI Research Intern
details: Built Python pipeline for 40,000+ patients.
Used SHAP, Plotly dashboards, and parametric survival models.
Delivered findings in Novartis internal seminar.
Developed a metaheuristic bio-inspired feature selection method.
Achieved 10% improvement in predictive accuracy.
Presented at European and international conferences.
Applied Cox regression and L1 penalization.
Enhanced mastitis detection via survival curve modeling.

Additional projects.name: AI-Powered Financial Sentiment Agent
details: Real-time integration with Yahoo Finance and Finviz news.
LLM-powered chatbot using Streamlit.
Used FinBERT for sentiment, OpenAI/LLaMA for summary.
Followed MLOps + LLMOps best practices with YAML configs, modular code.

Additional projects.name: Job Hunt Agent
details: Automates job search processes using AI.
Scrapes job listings and matches them with user profiles.
Implements NLP for resume parsing and job description analysis.

Additional projects.name: Portfolio Voice Agent
details: Developed an AI-powered, voice-enabled interactive portfolio using Streamlit and OpenAI APIs.
Integrated OpenAI GPT for third-person summary generation and OpenAI TTS-1 for natural-sounding voice playback.
Designed a modular UI with smart layout that includes section and subsection drilldown (Education, Projects, Experience, Publications).
Implemented session caching to avoid redundant OpenAI calls and improved load speed.
Allows autoplay of audio summaries and provides an engaging user experience with bullet-point transcripts.

Additional projects.name: Black Hole Detection using Modified Cuckoo Search
details: Proposed an improvement to the AODV routing protocol by embedding the Cuckoo Search Optimization algorithm to mitigate black hole attacks in Mobile Ad Hoc Networks (MANETs).
Developed the modified algorithm in C and integrated it into NS2 simulator for experimental testing across scenarios with increasing node and black hole counts.
Evaluated performance based on Quality of Service (QoS) metrics: Packet Delivery Ratio (PDR), End-to-End Delay, Throughput, and Packet Loss.
Achieved significant improvement in network performance with PDR reaching 95.45% in high node density conditions.
Demonstrated that the algorithm efficiently detects malicious nodes, reroutes data, and maintains stable performance even in the presence of multiple black holes.
Published in 'Innovative Computing and Communication: An International Journal', Vol.1, Issue 1, July 2019.

publications.title: MetaboVariation: Exploring Individual Variation in Metabolite Levels
publications.abstract: Introduces 'MetaboVariation', a Bayesian generalized linear model approach to analyze intra-individual metabolite level variations over time, facilitating the identification of early metabolic dysfunctions and paving the way for personalized healthcare strategies.

publications.title: Quantum Grey Wolf Optimization and Evolutionary Algorithms for Diagnosis of Alzheimer's Disease
publications.journal: International Journal of Modelling, Identification and Control
publications.abstract: Presents a comparative analysis of evolutionary algorithms, highlighting the efficacy of quantum grey wolf optimization in enhancing diagnostic accuracy for Alzheimer's disease through effective feature selection and classification.

publications.title: Bio-Inspired Algorithms for Diagnosis of Breast Cancer
publications.journal: International Journal of Innovative Computing and Applications
publications.abstract: Evaluates various bio-inspired algorithms, including artificial bee colony and particle swarm optimization, for breast cancer diagnosis, demonstrating improved accuracy in classification tasks.

publications.title: Modified Bio-Inspired Algorithms for Diagnosis of Breast Cancer Using Aggregation
publications.journal: International Journal of Innovative Computing and Applications
publications.abstract: Introduces an aggregated approach combining modified bio-inspired algorithms to enhance the diagnostic accuracy of breast cancer detection, achieving up to 97% accuracy with random forest classifiers.

publications.title: Black Hole Detection and Prevention in AODV Protocol using Modified Cuckoo Search Algorithm
publications.journal: Innovative Computing and Communication: An International Journal
publications.abstract: Proposes an enhancement to the AODV routing protocol by integrating a modified cuckoo search algorithm to effectively detect and prevent black hole attacks in mobile ad hoc networks, thereby improving network performance metrics.
